title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

09:52 <+sburjan> vmassol: fyi I will test today so we have a MTR for Monday (release day of RC1)  
09:54 <vmassol> sburjan:  
09:54 <vmassol> ok  
09:58 <vmassol> tmortagne: there's an Admin space on myxwiki.org for admin scripts. The space is protected  
09:58 <+tmortagne> ok  
09:59 <+tmortagne> I can see a {{include document="Main.Dashboard" /}} in this space home page but nothing displayed  
10:02 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: you should close XE-919. It seems fixed  
10:04 <+tmortagne> vmassol: isn't myxwiki.org supposed to be upgraded ? I can see it's 3.0RC1  
10:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: I did node1 but didn't finish. The problem is that sdumitriu started it  
10:04 <+tmortagne> so we have two node on different versions running ?  
10:05 <vmassol> so we now have two different versions runnig at the same time  
10:05 <vmassol> node1 is 3.1M2 while node2 is 3.0RC1  
10:05 <vmassol> and  
10:05 <vmassol> the XAR hasn't been imported  
10:05 <+tmortagne> ok  
10:06 <pulasthi> has left #xwiki

10:58 <vmassol> disabling node1.. I keep getting watchlist emails….  
11:00 <vmassol> this is a serious issue which makes 3.1M2 unusable in prod. We need to add ti to the RN. Can someone do this? tmortagne? (I have bad internet connection here)  
11:00 <vmassol> when I'm back home I'll upgrade myxwiki.org to the lastest snapshot and continue the upgrade  
11:01 <+tmortagne> vmassol: jerom  
11:02 <+tmortagne> sorry wrong too quick enter click  
11:02 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:02 <+tmortagne> vmassol: jerome just fixed the bug I asked him yesterday what could be put in release note  
11:03 <+tmortagne> (to workaround the bug and things like that)

12:20 <vmassol> sburjan: Hi. Could you put the test report on oracle at the same location as you put the test reports on xwiki.org?  
12:24 <@sdumitriu> is DocumentReferenceResolver new?  
12:24 <@sdumitriu> I didn't know about it  
12:25 <vmassol> sdumitriu: nope not new  
12:25 <@sdumitriu> No, @since 2.2  
12:32 <vmassol> we need to fix the port issue on jenkins….  
12:32 <vmassol> it keeps causing false positives  
12:33 <vmassol> I'm still at the conference and won't have much time to look at this today. If someone could fix it that would be great…. :)

15:20 <+sburjan> \*guys  
15:20 <+sburjan> I'll report it  
15:23 <sbose78> has quit  
15:24 <vmassol> FYI I've started writing a REST bridge for JMX to solve our port issue  
15:24 <vmassol> (could also be useful for other use cases)  
15:29 <vmassol> has quit  
15:29 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
15:44 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:37 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: What's the decision on directory name<->artifactId?  
16:38 <vmassol> sdumitriu: there isn't any I think but the question should be asked cleanly with a proposal I think  
16:38 <vmassol> right now it's hidden in some thread  
16:38 <vmassol> almost nobody has answered  
16:45 <vmassol> has quit  
16:50 <sburjan> has quit  
17:03 <kwoot> has quit  
17:17 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
17:33 <@cjdelisle> good afternoon/evening, was away due to power outage which gave me an oppertunity to rearrange my network  
17:34 <@cjdelisle> Should I close all of the Workspaces issues as won't-fix since workspaces is EOL'd?  
17:42 <@sdumitriu> Hm, no idea  
17:42 <@sdumitriu> Probably not  
17:48 <@cjdelisle> XWIKI-6086  
17:48 <@cjdelisle> XWIKI-5773  
17:48 <@cjdelisle> only 2 remaining fox-for rc1 issues  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> 6086 is probably by design  
17:52 <@sdumitriu> (see Vincent's comments)  
17:53 <@sdumitriu> For ECS, it can be moved, even if there are commits to it  
17:53 <@sdumitriu> It's an infrastructure change, so it's not important to mention any partial work in the RN  
17:54 <@cjdelisle> I would like to remove the fix-for entirely re: promising to "do it tomorrow"  
17:54 <@sdumitriu> Actually I'm working on that right now  
17:54 <@cjdelisle> but if somebody is on the job then I'm happy to let them set a fix-for for it  
17:54 <@cjdelisle> cool  
17:55 <@cjdelisle> yes and 6086 looks pretty minor and indeed by design. I can't imagine a lot of users are going to have trouble with it.  
17:57 <@sdumitriu> So, all clear for RC1?  
17:57 <@sdumitriu> Actually I'm fixing some of the bugs reported on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/TestReports/TestJiras  
17:57 <@cjdelisle> I still have to get the tests running  
17:58 <@cjdelisle> and vincent wanted to verify that all of the tests which fail are failing in error so I need his ok before we can go.  
17:59 <florinciu> has quit  
18:10 <arkub> has quit  
18:11 <abusenius> has quit  
18:33 <@cjdelisle> XWIKI-6650  
18:34 <@cjdelisle> grr new feature being slipped under the door  
18:34 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
18:37 <evalica> has quit  
18:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:55 <jvdrean> has quit  
19:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: didn't help it seems: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-cluster/668/testReport/org.apache.maven.surefire.junit4/JUnit4Provider/org\_xwiki\_test\_cluster\_AllTests/  
19:12 <@cjdelisle> I'm pretty sure I had it working locally last night  
19:13 <vmassol> it's probably environment dependent  
19:13 <@cjdelisle> Also I fixed that popup issue by adding a popup.dismiss() to the setSyntaxId function but apparently I forgot to commit  
19:13 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I fixed it  
19:13 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
19:13 <vmassol> there's no need for any dismiss  
19:13 <@cjdelisle> then a thunderstorm came and got my power  
19:13 <vmassol> nor for any popup :)  
19:14 <vmassol> (I fixed it this morning)  
19:14 <vmassol> (morning for me ;))  
19:14 <@cjdelisle> yes but if anyone uses that setSyntaxId() they're going to have the same problem  
19:14 <vmassol> ah yes  
19:14 <vmassol> you're right  
19:14 <@cjdelisle> I'll add it as well  
19:14 <vmassol> be careful that there not always a conversion  
19:15 <vmassol> (I mean there's not always a popup)  
19:15 <vmassol> (only if there's an available renderer for the target syntax)  
19:15 <@cjdelisle> hmm  
19:16 <@cjdelisle> I think it should at worst though throw an exception which is far better than ceasing up the executor  
19:16 <@cjdelisle> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/a81e4d814e1bf30886acb193c33afe32001dc614  
19:16 <@cjdelisle> And I want to not pull this into the RC1 branch.  
19:17 <vmassol> we need a proper soltuion  
19:17 <vmassol> throwing an exception is not a good solution either  
19:17 <@cjdelisle> We agreed no new features and we need to draw a line somewhere  
19:18 <@cjdelisle> I can add the line or I can leave it, for now it doesn't matter and I don't see the need to throw too many man/hours at this right now.  
19:18 <vmassol> I'm spending hours these days trying to fix exception/stck trace caused by sloppy programming we did in the past  
19:18 <vmassol> so I'd rather not have to fix this again in a few weeks if possible :)  
19:19 <vmassol> the build shouldn't throw unecessary stack traces  
19:19 <vmassol> in general  
19:19 <vmassol> some of our unit tests are really bad in this regard  
19:19 <vmassol> they throw lots of exception  
19:19 <vmassol> and when you look at the console you have to know the "normal" stack traces from the "error" stack traces  
19:19 <@cjdelisle> Well the issue is closed and we both have a huge amount of work ahead if we are going to have a release before 2012  
19:19 <+tmortagne> vmassol: re port issue, at least now we know ;) but it does not help much...  
19:20 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I've been working on fixing the port issue, I still need some time to finish fixing it  
19:20 <@cjdelisle> tmortagne: I don't like your patch to XWIKI-6650  
19:20 <vmassol> (I need fabio's help actually but he's not been online today)  
19:21 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: this is a work in progress in a feature branch  
19:21 <+tmortagne> you don''t have to like it right now :)  
19:21 <@cjdelisle> Oh, I'm sorry then.  
19:21 <vmassol> hmm  
19:21 <vmassol> I wonder how you see it's in a branch when looking at github  
19:21 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/a81e4d814e1bf30886acb193c33afe32001dc614  
19:21 <@cjdelisle> I would like it if everyone was giving a hand with the release but I can't complain too loudly if I don't have to remove it from the RC branch  
19:22 <@cjdelisle> s/release/stabilization/  
19:23 <+tmortagne> vmassol: indeed I can't see how to know that from the link you just gave  
19:23 <+tmortagne> not very handy  
19:24 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: I did most part of the work before actually and just committed/pushed today  
19:24 <@cjdelisle> ok you're forgiven ;)  
19:24 <+tmortagne> because I needed to switch to master actually  
19:25 <+tmortagne> even "Switch branches" does not tel you the current one  
19:26 <@cjdelisle> what I'm finding hard to understand it is says port in use but lsof | grep LISTEN is not giving me any listening ports  
19:26 <+tmortagne> problem is that a same commit can be on several branches right ? or do they have different id for each branch ?  
19:26 <@cjdelisle> so it must be bound but not listening or connected and that sounds like a mistake  
19:26 <@cjdelisle> they will have a different id  
19:26 <+tmortagne> ok  
19:27 <@cjdelisle> the id is like the sha1 of the entire source tree  
19:27 <vmassol> cjdelisle: indeed lsof -i :9010 did not give me anything after the tests were executed  
19:27 <+tmortagne> then github UI guy is lazy :)  
19:27 <@cjdelisle> so if the branch is precisely the same as the master then it's \_possible\_  
19:27 <@cjdelisle> I think it is indicated by the fact that the branch is at the top of the list  
19:28 <+tmortagne> looking if I can find github bug report  
19:28 <@cjdelisle> the "switch branches" list  
19:28 <vmassol> it's as if it was the maven java process that stops it  
19:28 <vmassol> (the port)  
19:28 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: I don't think so  
19:28 <@cjdelisle> running on local to see what happens...  
19:28 <+tmortagne> that's not how current branch is generally indicated in github  
19:28 <+tmortagne> look at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform for example  
19:31 <@cjdelisle> hmm  
19:32 <@cjdelisle> mm indeed there's some kind of mistake because the corrent branch is usually checked  
19:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: one idea would be to upgrade the jetty version we're using since 1) it's an upgrade release and 2) it could maybe stop the jmx subsystem better....  
19:34 <+tmortagne> vmassol: should not harm anyway  
19:35 <@cjdelisle> when is this upgrade?  
19:35 <@cjdelisle> for what version?  
19:35 <vmassol> what upgrade?  
19:35 <@cjdelisle> of jetty  
19:35 <vmassol> I don't any scheduled upgrade  
19:35 <vmassol> s/don't/don't know/  
19:35 <vmassol> but we do have a jira about it  
19:35 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: I think vmassol meant that 3.1 is more a less an upgrade branch or lots of things  
19:36 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6525  
19:36 <@cjdelisle> "indeed there's some kind of mistake because the corrent branch"  
19:36 <@cjdelisle> argh  
19:36 <@cjdelisle> "one idea would be to upgrade the jetty version we're using"  
19:37 <vmassol> upgrading to jetty 7 is quite some work though  
19:37 <vmassol> probaby less work to finish my REST JMX resource  
19:37 <+tmortagne> sorry I have to go, alone with my daughter this evening. It's lots of work theses little things ;)  
19:37 <@cjdelisle> and if you start committing that into RC1 then I'm releasing from a fork  
19:37 <vmassol> yeah....  
19:38 <vmassol> wait till you have 3 and you'll see :)  
19:38 <+tmortagne> :)  
19:38 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
19:44 <vmassol> has quit  
20:31 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
20:31 <Chami1> has left #xwiki  
20:45 <@cjdelisle> sdumitriu: why do we have sessionVariables=sql\_mode='' set in the mysql section of hibernate.xml?  
20:46 <@cjdelisle> http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=61201  
20:46 <@sdumitriu> There's supposed to be a comment above that  
20:46 <@cjdelisle> (Can't establish connection when url has sessionVariables and characterEncoding)  
20:46 <@cjdelisle> ahh missed it  
20:46 <@cjdelisle> XWIKI-1945  
21:32 <@cjdelisle> Is it safe to recommend as an option removal of characterEncoding=utf8 from the url?  
21:32 <@cjdelisle> hmm probably not  
21:32 <@cjdelisle> untested and such  
21:32 <@cjdelisle> nvm
